Package il.org.spartan.utils

Interface Recursive<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Duplo<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Recursive.Atomic<T>, Recursive.Compound<T>, Recursive.Postorder<E>, Recursive.Preorder<E>, Rule<T,​R>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Proposition.Not, Proposition.Singleton, Rule.CountingDelegator, Rule.Interceptor, Rule.Stateful
    public interface Recursive<T>
extends Duplo<T>
    Organizes objects of the __ parameter in a tree, supplying a #descendants() of all objects contained in a sub-tree. Object of the __ parameter may present on all nodes on of this tree, including inner nodes.

    TODO Dor Maayan & Oran Gilboa: first assignment TODO Oren Afek & Ori Roth & Matan Peled: first assignments

    1. Implement interface Nested for the same concept, except that stream return ancestors.
    2. Factor commonalities between the new interface and this interface. What should the new interface be called?
    3. Create a new interface that unifies Nested and Recursive, to be called what?
    4. Re-implement class Environment using the diamond hierarchy that you are
    5. Revise material on design patterns. Do you think interface names should be changed? How? Write your answer as JavaDOC: don't bother with formatting.
    6. Otherwise, don't touch any documentation, before you attend the JavaDOC lecture. Do add @author and @since, but nothing more. You will have to document this interface, and all methods, but only after that.
    7. If there are Test methods, make sure they run. Don't add any tests, even if you think you know what you are doing, before attending the TDD lecture.
    8. Apply self judgment, don't come running to me with every little dilemma you have.

    2017-03-11
